text: - Pinterest is a cloud native company

that delivers inspiration to
450 million people every month.

Operating on the cloud allowed
us to grow very quickly,
generate large amounts of data,

and then we determined
that we needed to really be
in a great position for disaster recovery.

We identified our need to
have a disaster recovery plan.

We engaged with Amazon
Web Services to evaluate

how we would take our
nearly exabyte of data

and find a way to version it
and distribute it regionally.
And we engaged with AWS Proserve
to help build that solution
on top of some existing solutions.
We're already on Amazon Web Services.

All of our data's there
and working with Proserve,

they already had a pre-developed
solution we could extend
and it was just a natural fit

for what we needed to do
for disaster recovery.
The effort for our customers is
if something were to go wrong

and we were to lose data
on AWS, intentional or not,

the business could be
challenged and be down, right,

and people couldn't get to
Pinterest for their inspiration,
so it really protects our end users

we call pinners to make sure
Pinterest is always available.
